title: Malin Akerman makes a splash in lace-trim pantsuit as she leads stars at Bring Change To Mind gala
text:
Malin Akerman led the stars at the annual Bring Change To Mind gala when it was held in San Francisco on Wednesday.

The 41-year-old posed up a storm at the event, showing off her cleavage by going topless under her perfectly fitted pantsuit.

Her outfit was midnight blue and featured strips of stylish white and baby blue lace trim running down the sleeves and pant legs.

Radiant: Malin Akerman led the stars at the annual Bring Change To Mind gala when it was held in San Francisco on Wednesday

Comedian Margaret Cho was a showstopping presence at the event, showing off her tattoos in a print tank top as she posed for the cameras.

The 50-year-old, who originally hails from San Francisco, brought a furry friend to the event - her rescue chihuahua Lucia.

Ben Stiller went for classical elegance in a black suit and a charcoal tie, rounding off the look with a white dress shirt and leather shoes.

The Secret Life Of Walter Mitty star, 53, has let a distinguished bit of grey creep into his hair and flashed his signature smile for the photographers.

He could be spotted standing for photos at the event with none other than Zachary Pym Williams, the 36-year-old son of the late Robin Williams.

Ben and Robin co-starred in the Night At The Museum movies, with the former playing night watchman Larry and the latter playing Teddy Roosevelt.

The glamorous event also included Annie Starke, whose The Wife co-star Glenn Close is a co-founder of Bring Change To Mind.

Attendees of the gala, which is for a nonprofit that aims to raise awareness for mental health issues, were treated to a performance by Darren Criss.

Darren, who played serial killer Andrew Cunanan in last year's FX anthology The Assassination Of Gianni Versace: American Crime Story, wore a black suit.

The small screen hunk teamed the suit with a wine-colored shirt and accompanied himself on the guitar as he sang for the crowd.
